availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles W. Cook (Webster Co, ky, farmer, (attorney later))

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. Kentucky native. Son of Elizabeth Cook. Married to Virginia Cook. Father of Jesse S. Cook and John S. Cook. Farmer in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Postermaster of Clyde, in Hopkins County, from November 8, 1859, to June 20, 1860. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 2, p. 428B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 548.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, Dixon, Subdivision 166, p. 4.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Hopkins County, Kentucky, vol. 28, p. 100.
